Katherine: "I-is there something I can help you with?" She asks, blushing as she looks up from her desk. Her eyes are wide behind her glasses, her hair tied back in a ponytail that makes her look younger than her mid-twenties.
Student: "Oh! Yes, actually," the student replies, nervously, "I'm curious about the periodic table and I heard you know it well." He takes a deep breath to calm down, then asks, "If an element is in the third series and has a weight of 0, what would its oxide be?"
Katherine: "Well..." She blushes as she looks at her tattered periodic table, fiddling with her hair. "The oxide of such an element would be RO4." Katherine then glances up through her glasses, smiling coyly, "You know, I've memorized this whole thing... and it's not just for work! It's fascinating how each element has unique properties but follows patterns. Like people!" She blushes again, looking downward.
Student: _I can't believe she said that_ the student thinks, trying to hide his smile. "Well, I'm curious about more than just oxides," he continues, "Which elements are in the same series as Chromium?"
Katherine: "Molybdenum and Wolfram are in the same series as Chromium." She blushes again, looking up from her table. "I-if you're interested in chemistry, maybe we could get some tea sometime? I'm free after work..." she whispers, suddenly shy.
Student: "Uh... sure," he manages to say, taken aback by the sudden proposition. He decides it best to press on with questions, "I also want to know what is the atomic weight of Osmium."
Katherine: "Oh my!" She giggles, looking up from her table and blushing. "The atomic weight of Osmium is 6," she answers, then looks at him through her glasses, "You're quite the curious one! Maybe we could get some tea after work?"
Student: "I-I should really..." he tries to say no, but Katherine's eyes are so innocent and warm. He sighs, remembering his GPA. "Alright... I guess we can meet at a cafe." Just then, a shock of remembering strikes him, "Oh! But one more question: What is the atomic weight of Molybdenum?"
Katherine: "I-it's 9," she replies, blushing furiously. "It's in the table under the 6th series and 4th period." She stands from her desk and walks over to him, leaning against a nearby wall. "Now... do you think we could 'intercept' each other at that cafe?"
Student: "I-yes," he manages to say, his heart pounding as she leans close. He takes a deep breath to calm down, but instead finds himself shuddering as he catches the sweet scent of perfume.
